text: Steve Fritz (born November 1, 1967 in Salina, Kansas) is an American retired decathlete. Fritz played basketball and competed in track and field for Kansas State University. He was an All-American and Big 12 champion decathlete in 1989 and 1990.K-State Sports: Four Former Wildcats Named to Kansas Sports Hall of Fame Class of 2020 Fritz set the Kansas State school record for points in the decathlon. Fritz represented the United States on 10 national teams for decathlon, including a first-place finish at the 1991 Summer Universiade in Sheffield, England and a fourth-place finish at the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta, Georgia. Fritz was named to the K-State Athletics Hall of Fame in 2000 and enshrined to the Kansas Sports Hall of Fame on October 4, 2020. Fritz was an assistant coach for the Kansas State track and field team for 21 years, and is currently the assistant basketball coach at Wamego High School. He is also the track coach at Wamego Middle School. ==Personal life== His wife, Suzie Fritz, is the current head coach of the Kansas State Wildcats women's volleyball team. His son, T.J. Fritz, played basketball for Wamego High School, where he averaged 22.4 points per game in 2018 as a senior, which led Kansas Class 4A. Fritz then reclassified from the class of 2019 to the class of 2020 and enrolled at Sunrise Christian Academy in Bel Aire, KS,The Manhattan Mercury: Wamego's Fritz reclassifies to 2020, will head to Sunrise Christian Academy considered one of the best basketball high schools in the world,MaxPreps: 2019-20 Top 25 High School Boys Basketball Rankings to play for their post-graduate team. After his season at Sunrise, Fritz committed to the University of Nebraska-Kearney on April 15, 2020.The Manhattan Mercury: Former Wamego star TJ Fritz signs with Nebraska-Kearney ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing the |- |1991 |Universiade |Sheffield, England |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Decathlon |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |7th |Decathlon |- |1994 |Goodwill Games |St. Petersburg, Russia |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Decathlon |- |1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States |4th |Decathlon |- |rowspan=2|1997 |World Indoor Championships |Paris, France |6th |Heptathlon |- |World Championships |Athens, Greece |4th |Decathlon |} ==References== ==External links== * *GBR Athletics Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Salina, Kansas Category:Kansas State Wildcats men's basketball players Category:American male decathletes Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic track and field athletes of the United States Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Goodwill Games medalists in athletics Category:American men's basketball players Category:Universiade gold medalists for the United States Category:Medalists at the 1991 Summer Universiade
title: Steve Fritz
